title: Nigel Kennedy - Blue Notes
description:
Violin 		Nigel Kennedy
Tenor Sax	Joe Lavano
Bass		Ron Carter
Drums		Jach DeJohnette
Year		1996
file		mp3
Bitrate		192 kbit/s

Nigel Kennedy is a classical virtuoso violonist. He was identified as a child prodigy and was awarded a scholarship to attend Yehudi Menhuin school in Surrey England.
When Nigel was seventeen he played att Carnegie Hall with jazz violonist Stephane Grappelli. At Greenwich Village clubs he performed together with Stan Getz.
Carter (bass) and DeJohnette (drums) have both worked together with Miles Davis amongst many other famous jazz musicans.
This is a great all round album and would appeal to anyone who is either into jazz or oon the look out for something really clean, modern and technically brilliant.

Tracks

01 Midnight Blue
02 Sudel
03 Maybe In Your Dreams
04 Sunshine Alley
05 Nearly
06 Expansions
07 Stranger In A Stranger Land
08 Song For My Father
09 After The Rain
10 I Almost Lost My Mind
11 Song For Worls Forgiveness
